p: After 12 h inoculation, a first substrate conversion was indicated by beginning color development in the microplate wells. AWCD then rapidly increased from 12–180 h incubation followed by clear differentiation among different treatments. After 180 h we observed a steady, saturating increase ( Fig 2). Higher AWCD values were maintained in controls compared to all extract concentrations until the end of the incubation period of 240 h ( Fig 2). At the peak (i.e., 180 h), results indicate that AWCD decreased by 15.20%, 5.71%, 23.46% and 28.56% at 2.5, 5, 7.5, and 10 mg·mL -1 concentrations compared to control, respectively (all P < 0.05, Fig 2).
